section.heading: Fees.
section.text: The Motor Vehicle Administration shall assess the fees listed in Regulations .02—.06 of this chapter.

tr.td: E. Inspection fee. Paid by an owner of a vehicle for which a salvage certificate has been issued who is applying for a certificate of title for the vehicle

section.heading: Driver's License and Identification Card Fees.

tr.td: A. Learner's Instructional Permit (Type 1Initial Noncommercial License). This fee includes issuance of an initial driver's license if the applicant meets all requirements before permit expiration, and includes the $5 fee for the conversion of provisional license to driver's license.

B. Learner's Instructional Permit (Type 2Subsequent Noncommercial License). This fee applies to learner's permits issued for purposes other than that of the initial license, and includes issuance of the license if the applicant meets all requirements before permit expiration.
(1) Instructional Permit. Includes issuance of license if issued before permit expiration.
(2) New Issuance. If a learner's instructional permit is not required.
F. Driver's license or privilege to drive—application for reinstatement:
(3) Issued to an incarcerated individual within 60 days of release from the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services or Federal Bureau of Prisons.
(4) New or corrected issued to youths approved by the Department of Juvenile Services.
(5) New or corrected issued to youths 15 to 20 years of age approved by the Department of Human Services for participation in certain programs.
(6) New or corrected issued to a homeless individual presenting documentation in accordance with COMAR 11.17.21.05A(5).
I. The fee for a driver's license or identification card issued for a period of time other than 5 years may be prorated on a 1-year basis.
(1) Special registration plates without emblem or logo. Fee paid on issuance of new or replacement plates.
(2) Special registration plates with emblem or logo. Fee paid on issuance of new or replacement plates.
(a) Fee paid on issuance of new plates.
(b) Annual fee in addition to the annual registration fee required.
(4) Special registration plates honoring State Agriculture.
(a) Fee paid on issuance of new plates.
(b) Annual fee in addition to the annual registration fee required.
(a) Fee paid on issuance of new plates.
(b) Annual fee in addition to the annual registration fee required.
B. Replacement of registration plates, validation tabs, and registration card.
C. Replacement of registration card of unaffixed validation tabs, or both.
D. Issuance of duplicate or additional registration card.
F. Penalty fee—registration flag or suspension removal.
G. Unused Registration Plates. This fee applies to the processing of a registration refund.
(1) New and used vehicle dealer (class 1A plates)
(4) Automotive dismantler, recycler, and scrap processor (class 2) plates
(3) Nonresident permit for vehicles not subject to registration
(4) Nonresident farm vehicle temporary registration plate:
(7) Nontitled in Maryland IRP registration fee
E. Trailer dealer—trailers less than 15 feet in length or boat trailers.
I. Manufacturer or distributor fee based on number of vehicles transferred to dealers during previous license year, as follows:
M. Drivers' school license application fee.
N. Drivers' school or branch license (includes 2-year renewal).
Q. Conversion of an apprentice instructor's permit to an instructor's license.
R. Duplicate/corrected license issued under Title 15.
S. Vehicle inspection station license fees as follows:
A. Vehicle emissions inspection fee. Every other year.
B. Vehicle emissions reinspection fee. After initial free inspection.
C. Vehicle emissions inspection advanced testing fee. Every other year.
D. Vehicle emissions inspection late fee. Per month or part of it.
E. Vehicle emissions inspection fleet test fee, per vehicle passed.
G. Driver improvement program rescheduling fee.
I. Alcohol education program rescheduling fee.
M. Copies of driver or vehicle records as follows:
N. Sales of Partial Records or Listings.
O. Restoration of repossessed documents or plates.

section.heading: Preemption.
section.text: If the fees established by this chapter conflict with any other provision of COMAR Title 11, Subtitles 11—22, the fees in this chapter prevail.
